title: Vikings’ Alexander Ludwig misses co-star girlfriend as she takes on new project
text:
Vikings’ Alexander Ludwig misses co-star girlfriend as she takes on new project (Picture: Getty)

Vikings’ Alexander Ludwig is at it again with his soppy posts, as he’s been left pining over his co-star girlfriend.

Yes, taking to Instagram, the actor revealed his lover Kristy Dawn Dinsmore has started work on a new project.

But while she’s away living the high life in Canada, it seems he’s been left to fend for himself, and he’s sure noticing her absence.

Sharing a loved up selfie of the pair, the Bjorn star told his 2.2million followers just how proud he is of his gal.

‘This one is off to film an awesome new project but it’s hush hush for now,’ the 27-year-old wrote alongside the snap.

‘Missing you @_kristydawndinsmore and so damn proud of you!’

View this post on Instagram A post shared by Alexander Ludwig (@alexanderludwig) on Oct 26, 2019 at 9:01am PDT

Alexander is getting ready for the season six launch of the History Channel hit, Vikings.

Sharing the latest trailer with his fans, he expressed how much love he has for the historical saga.

‘I hope you are all as excited as I am for the epic ending all our amazing fans deserve,’ he said before adding: ‘But before that..it gets insane…. so much love to you all.’

The star continued: ‘I really can’t believe we have managed to end the show the way we hoped we would when we started. It is all because of you! Enjoy!’

It looks as though his character Bjorn will be facing a new enemy while battling it out one last time with his brother Ivar The Boneless.

The trailer states that the Cold War has started – but how many more battles can Bjorn survive before he enters the gates of Valhalla?

Ivar warns his sibling: ‘You have no idea what you are now facing,’ to which the warrior can be heard shouting: ‘We must resist.’

Staring out to sea, he adds: ‘Nothing will ever be the same again.’

Has he lost hope, and will he start to give up? Or will Bjorn see the end of the battle and take home the crown – finally defeating Ivar?

We guess we will just have to wait and see, as Vikings season 6 returns to the History Channel and Amazon Prime on 4 December.
